channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2023100878
item.description:
Report E-2023100878

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023100857
item.description:
Report E-2023100857

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon box of UN3267 was punctured by a forklift during loading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ambipar Response (AR) to remediate the impacted site. AR deployed a neutralizer and absorbents to the impacted concrete. The crew collected the spent neutralizer, absorbents, and damaged container into one (1) 55-gallon drum. AR staged the drum onsite to be processed via R+L's normal waste stream.

item.title: Report X-2023081376
item.description:
Report X-2023081376

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: Irondale
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a leak coming from the protective housing on tank car MULX702015. Upon inspection by a contractor, both liquid line valves were found partially open and the closure plugs were less than tool tight. The valves were closed and the plugs were properly secured.
